title: Question 26: Who tempted them to this sin?
question: Who tempted them to this sin?
answer: The devil tempted Eve, and she gave the fruit to Adam.

title: Question 27: What happened to our first parents when they had sinned?
question: What happened to our first parents when they had sinned?
answer: Instead of being holy and happy, they became sinful and miserable.

title: Question 28: What effect did the sin of Adam have on all mankind?
question: What effect did the sin of Adam have on all mankind?
answer: All mankind is born in a state of sin and misery.

title: Question 29: What do we inherit from Adam as a result of this original sin?
question: What do we inherit from Adam as a result of this original sin?
answer: A sinful nature.

title: Question 30: What is sin?
question: What is sin?
answer: Sin is any transgression of the law of God.

title: Question 31: What is meant by transgression?
question: What is meant by transgression?
answer: Doing what God forbids.

title: Question 32: What does every sin deserve?
question: What does every sin deserve?
answer: The anger and judgment of God.

title: Question 33: Do we know what God requires of us?
question: Do we know what God requires of us?
answer: Yes, he has given us his law both in our hearts and in writing.

title: Question 34: How many commandments did God give on Mt. Sinai?
question: How many commandments did God give on Mt. Sinai?
answer: Ten commandments.

title: Question 35: What are the ten commandments sometimes called?
question: What are the ten commandments sometimes called?
answer: God’s moral law.

title: Question 36: What do the first four commandments teach?
question: What do the first four commandments teach?
answer: Our duty to God.

title: Question 37: What do the last six commandments teach?
question: What do the last six commandments teach?
answer: Our duty to our fellow men.

title: Question 38: What is the sum of the ten commandments?
question: What is the sum of the ten commandments?
answer: To love God with all my heart, and my neighbor as myself.

title: Question 39: Who is your neighbor?
question: Who is your neighbor?
answer: All my fellow men are my neighbors.

title: Question 40: Is God pleased with those who love and obey him?
question: Is God pleased with those who love and obey him?
answer: Yes. He says, 'I love them that love me.'

title: Question 41: Is God pleased with those who do not love and obey him?
question: Is God pleased with those who do not love and obey him?
answer: No. 'God is angry with the wicked every day.'

title: Question 42: What is the first commandment?
question: What is the first commandment?
answer: The first commandment is, 'You shall have no other gods before me.'

title: Question 43: What does the first commandment teach us?
question: What does the first commandment teach us?
answer: To worship God only.

title: Question 44: What is the second commandment?
question: What is the second commandment?
answer: The second commandment is, 'You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth. You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I the Lord your God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and the fourth generation of those who hate me, but showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.'

title: Question 45: What does the second commandment teach us?
question: What does the second commandment teach us?
answer: To worship God in the right way, and to avoid idolatry.

title: Question 46: What is the third commandment?
question: What is the third commandment?
answer: The third commandment is, 'You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.'

title: Question 47: What does the third commandment teach us?
question: What does the third commandment teach us?
answer: To reverence God’s name, word, and works.

title: Question 48: What is the fourth commandment?
question: What is the fourth commandment?
answer: The fourth commandment is, 'Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. Six days you shall labor, and do all your work, but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, you, or your son, or your daughter, your male servant, or your female servant, or your livestock, or the sojourner who is within your gates. For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested on the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.'

title: Question 49: What does the fourth commandment teach us?
question: What does the fourth commandment teach us?
answer: To keep the Sabbath holy.

title: Question 50: What day of the week is the Christian Sabbath?
question: What day of the week is the Christian Sabbath?
answer: The first day of the week, called the Lord’s Day.
